poem:
Title: In Pursuit of Unseen Light

In every steel chest, a hidden glow,
Ignored by eyes, but known by the frost.
A hushed whisper beneath the hum.
The light that shines when the door is lost.
In freezer's dark, a silent flame,
Veiled by the chill, yet it plays the game.
Next time you seek the cold delight,
Remember, there is always a veiled light.
